name: Korean-Inspired Rice Paper Rolls
author: Julia Bauman
summary: A Korean-influenced take on Vietnamese fresh rolls. An easy and delicious recipe to serve as a side or an entree. Serve with the dipping sauce of your choice. I recommend serving Korean barbecue sauce!
ingredients: 6 ounces firm tofu, cut into rectangles
1 tablespoon soy sauce, or to taste
½ cup fresh spinach, or to taste, stems removed
¼ cup peanuts, or to taste
directions: Saute tofu with oil and soy sauce in a pan over medium heat until golden brown, 5 to 10 minutes
Wet a rice paper wrapper in a large bowl of water then lay flat on a plate
Add 5 to 6 leaves spinach to the center
Place 1 to 2 pieces tofu on top
Add enough kimchi to cover the tofu, 1 to 2 tablespoons black beans, and several peanuts
While the rice paper is still soft, fold in sides and roll up around the filling
